page.title: 09OLD CUSTOMS IN ST.IVES
page.content: { Feast Monday}(a church festival) is held on the first Monday after Feb. 3rd. At 10.30 a.m. the Mayor hurls an inscribed{silver ball}from the church garden wall into the crowd. The person (usually a school child) who returns it to the Guildhall at 12.00 receives a crown (25p). This ceremony derives from an ancient team game. { Guise dancing},once a Christmas festivity has been revived for Feast. Disguised dancers led by musicians dance through the streets and houses. { Knills Ceremony},held every 5 years, involves dancing around an unused mausoleum built by John Knill, an ex-mayor, in the 1780's.The 2 widows and 10 young girls who dance receive small sums of money from Knills will. A{Good Friday}tradition is sailing model yachts on{Consols pond}.
